title: the Lighthouse service appears to be abnormal.
body:
## Description

After configuring authrpc using the domain name, the Lighthouse service appears to be abnormal.
After configuring using the IP method, the service works fine.

     Lighthouse node
     root@eth-archive-lighthouse-5-0:/# cat /etc/hosts
    127.0.0.1	localhost
     10.12.147.56 erigon-0

      containers:
      -
        name: bn-node
        image: sigp/lighthouse:v3.1.2
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        command:
        - lighthouse
        args:
        - --network=mainnet
        - --datadir=/chain-data/lighthouse
        - bn
        - --http
        - --execution-endpoint=http://erigon-0:8551
        - --execution-jwt=/chain-data/erigon/jwt.hex
        - --http-port=5052
        - --http-allow-origin=*
        - --http-address=0.0.0.0
        - --logfile-max-number=0
        - --metrics



## Version

lighthouse v3.1.2

## Present Behaviour
```shell


 Oct 05 23:50:41.607 WARN Error connecting to eth1 node endpoint  action: trying fallbacks, endpoint: http://erigon-0:8551/, auth=true, service: deposit_contract_rpc                                                                â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:50:41.607 ERRO No synced execution endpoint            advice: ensure you have an execution node configured via --execution-endpoint or if pre-merge, --eth1-endpoints, service: deposit_contract_rpc

 Oct 05 23:46:41.607 WARN Error connecting to eth1 node endpoint  action: trying fallbacks, endpoint: http://erigon-0:8551/, auth=true, service: deposit_contract_rpc                                                                â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:46:41.607 ERRO No synced execution endpoint            advice: ensure you have an execution node configured via --execution-endpoint or if pre-merge, --eth1-endpoints, service: deposit_contract_rpc                     â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:46:41.607 ERRO Error updating deposit contract cache   error: "All fallbacks errored: http://erigon-0:8551/, auth=true => EndpointError(RequestFailed(\"eth_chainId call failed Auth(InvalidToken)\"))", retry_millis: 60 â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:46:43.760 ERRO Execution engine call failed            error: Auth(InvalidToken), service: exec
```

## Expected Behaviour
```shell

â”‚ Oct 05 23:46:43.768 ERRO Failed jwt authorization                error: InvalidToken, service: exec                                                                                                                                 â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:46:53.001 INFO Syncing                                 est_time: --, distance: 102 slots (20 mins), peers: 13, service: slot_notifier                                                                                     â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:46:55.835 ERRO Failed jwt authorization                error: InvalidToken, service: exec                                                                                                                                 â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:46:55.835 ERRO Failed jwt authorization                error: InvalidToken, service: exec                                                                                                                                 â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:47:05.001 INFO Syncing                                 est_time: --, distance: 103 slots (20 mins), peers: 12, service: slot_notifier                                                                                     â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:47:07.770 ERRO Failed jwt authorization                error: InvalidToken, service: exec                                                                                                                                 â”‚
â”‚ Oct 05 23:47:17.001 INFO Syncing                                 est_time: --, distance: 104 slots (20 mins), peers: 11, service: slot_notifier   
```                                                                                  
## Steps to resolve

NO

If you're using a name other than `localhost` to refer to Erigon then you need to set `--authrpc.vhosts=$name`, e.g. `--authrpc.vhosts=erigon-0`. This prevents DNS rebinding attacks. See: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon#beacon-chain-consensus-layer

```
Oct 06 01:56:53.001 INFO Synced                                  slot: 4849782, block: 0x6fe6â€¦e573, epoch: 151555, finalized_epoch: 151553, finalized_root: 0xfe21â€¦bd7b, exec_hash: 0x0c01â€¦499a (unverified), peers: 21, service: slot_notifier
Oct 06 01:56:59.794 INFO New block received                      root: 0xbbc8e034b50daae4b91e3affa81a26b4bc1d46251b46385288df44a7fb746e64, slot: 4849783
Oct 06 01:57:05.000 WARN Head is optimistic                      execution_block_hash: 0xd8382912e293dd15fa45f519eec15eeb9191a9e4141fd3b9ed8c117b042864be, info: chain not fully verified, block and attestation production disabled until execution engine syncs, service: slot_notifier
Oct 06 01:57:05.000 INFO Synced                                  slot: 4849783, block: 0xbbc8â€¦6e64, epoch: 151555, finalized_epoch: 151553, finalized_root: 0xfe21â€¦bd7b, exec_hash: 0xd838â€¦64be (unverified), peers: 20, service: slot_notifier
Oct 06 01:57:11.990 INFO New block received                      root: 0xec91f4f3db1a694673baeb4926f81b4b09790b538aa7a2bd53d33db6d85a2757, slot: 4849784
Oct 06 01:57:17.001 WARN Head is optimistic                      execution_block_hash: 0xe372e851bf43cef58a83a3ae22b203aa0454eca824428251bcf4734f1a1ef2fa, info: chain not fully verified, block and attestation production disabled until execution engine syncs, service: slot_notifier
Oct 06 01:57:17.001 INFO Synced                                  slot: 4849784, block: 0xec91â€¦2757, epoch: 151555, finalized_epoch: 151553, finalized_root: 0xfe21â€¦bd7b, exec_hash: 0xe372â€¦f2fa (unverified), peers: 19, service: slot_notifier
```

I've updated the configuration parameters. According to the lighthouse log, this appears to be normal.
Yeah that looks good! The `(unverified)` status should change to `(verified)` as soon as Erigon finishes syncing.
I'll close this as resolved, please re-open if you encounter any further problems :blush:

> I'll close this as resolved, please re-open if you encounter any further problems ðŸ˜Š

Thanks
